intro: Anil inhambanensis, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It produces small, round berries that turn red when mature. Anil inhambanensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
